### **WCAG Guidelines Addressed**
<!-- Which WCAG 2.1 guidelines would this feature help meet? -->
- [ ] **1.1.1 Non-text Content** - Text alternatives for non-text content
- [ ] **1.3.1 Info and Relationships** - Programmatic relationships
- [ ] **1.4.1 Use of Color** - Color is not used as the only visual means
- [ ] **2.1.1 Keyboard** - All functionality available via keyboard
- [ ] **2.4.1 Bypass Blocks** - Skip links and navigation shortcuts
- [ ] **3.1.1 Language of Page** - Page language identification
- [ ] **4.1.2 Name, Role, Value** - Proper labeling of interactive elements

### **User Impact**
<!-- Who would benefit most from this feature? -->
- [ ] **Screen reader users** - Enhanced navigation and content understanding
- [ ] **Keyboard-only users** - Improved keyboard accessibility
- [ ] **Low vision users** - Better visual accessibility features
- [ ] **Color blind users** - Color-independent information presentation
- [ ] **Cognitive disabilities** - Simplified interfaces and clearer content
- [ ] **Motor disabilities** - Alternative input methods and larger targets

### **Priority Level**
<!-- How important is this feature? -->
- [ ] **Critical** - Essential for basic accessibility compliance
- [ ] **High** - Important for improved user experience
- [ ] **Medium** - Nice-to-have accessibility enhancement
- [ ] **Low** - Minor accessibility improvement

### **Implementation Scope**
<!-- How complex would this be to implement? -->
- [ ] **Small** - Simple configuration or style changes
- [ ] **Medium** - Component-level changes
- [ ] **Large** - Architecture or system-level changes
- [ ] **Complex** - Requires major refactoring or new systems

<!-- Any technical constraints or requirements? -->
<!-- Browser compatibility, performance impact, etc. -->

### **Testing Requirements**
<!-- How can this feature be tested and verified? -->
- [ ] **Automated testing** - Can be tested with axe-core/jest-axe
- [ ] **Manual testing** - Requires assistive technology testing
- [ ] **User testing** - Should be tested with users with disabilities
- [ ] **Cross-browser testing** - Needs verification across browsers

### **Checklist for Review**
- [ ] Feature addresses a genuine accessibility need
- [ ] Implementation is technically feasible
- [ ] Feature aligns with WCAG guidelines
- [ ] Benefits outweigh implementation complexity
- [ ] Testing approach is well-defined
